benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: DELETE /1.0/kb/invoiceItems/{invoiceItemId}/customFields - Remove custom fields from invoice item

covered: Valid Deletion: Multiple success paths return 204 and verify fields are actually removed (all fields, subsets, single field, none).
Non-Existent Resource: 404 when invoice item does not exist.
Input Validation: 400 for invalid invoiceItemId format and malformed customField IDs; mixed valid/invalid IDs handled.
Headers: Required X-Killbill-CreatedBy enforced (400 when missing); optional headers Reason/Comment accepted; robustness to header formatting; long Comment accepted.
Large Input: Many customField IDs supported.
Robustness: Duplicate customField IDs tolerated; extra query params do not break deletion.
Operational Resilience: Service unavailability returns 503; performance under load validated; SQL injection attempt rejected.
gaps: Concurrency: No scenarios for simultaneous deletions or race conditions (e.g., two clients deleting same fields/item).
Idempotency/Repeat Operations: No test for deleting specific fields that were already removed in a prior request (should remain 204 and be no-op).
Non-existent customField IDs: Behavior unspecified/untested when provided UUIDs are well-formed but do not belong to the invoice item (currently only malformed or mixed invalid formats are tested).
Authorization 403: No scenario for authenticated user lacking permission/role to delete custom fields.
Soft Deletes: No explicit verification whether deletion is soft vs hard (if applicable) and audit trail behavior.
Error Contract: No validation of error response schema/fields for 400/404/503; only message presence checked.
Response Headers: No checks for Content-Type or absence thereof on 204, nor for standard headers (e.g., correlation/request IDs) if required by API standards.
Header Limits/Validation: No negative test for exceeding maximum header sizes (e.g., Comment too long) or invalid characters in headers.
Rate Limiting/Throttling: No test for 429 under burst deletes, if enforced.
recommendations: Add concurrency tests: parallel DELETEs on the same invoice item and overlapping customField subsets; assert consistent final state and appropriate status codes.
Add idempotency tests: repeat the same DELETE (all fields and subset) and expect 204 with no side effects.
Add scenario for well-formed but non-existent customField IDs: define expected behavior (ignore and 204 vs 400/404) and test it.
Include a 403 Forbidden scenario for an authenticated user without sufficient permissions.
Clarify and test soft-delete vs hard-delete behavior and verify audit entries are recorded as expected.
Validate error response schema: status, code, message, and requestId fields for 400/404/503; not just message presence.
Assert response headers: for 204 ensure empty body and appropriate Content-Type (or absence) per API spec; include any standard headers required.
Add negative header validation: X-Killbill-Comment exceeding max length or containing invalid characters should return proper error.
If applicable, add rate limiting tests to verify 429 and Retry-After behavior under bursts.
